name: Priti Patel
Basic Info: Priti Patel, Conservative MP for Witham
Property Analysis: Priti Patel voted against the Renters' Rights Bill, which would have improved tenant rights.
max_hospitality_description: I received a delegate ticket (value £1,500) for the ARC Conference to enable my attendance on 17 February 2025 in my capacity as Shadow Foreign Secretary
DonorCategories: the Premier League and its clubs, the Embassy of Bahrain
Hospitality Analysis:
Priti Patel has received a total of £7,140 in hospitality and gifts since the last election.
This means he!she ranks at #15 for most hospitality received.
The most expensive declaration was worth £2,400, described as 'I received a delegate ticket (value £1,500) for the ARC Conference to enable my attendance on 17 February 2025 in my capacity as Shadow Foreign Secretary' from Alliance for Responsible Citizenship Ltd.
He!She has received 4 gifts valued at over £500.
He!She has declared gifts or hospitality from the Premier League and its clubs and the Embassy of Bahrain.
The Premier League and its clubs have been lobbying to water down regulations designed to ensure greater sharing of revenues throughout the sport.
The UK government has been accused of collusion with the oppressive practices of the government of Bahrain by continuing to sell them arms despite well-documented human rights abuses.
Other Analysis:
Priti Patel has claimed a total of £7,043 in expenses since the last election.
His!Her expense total all comes from office costs.

name: Paul Foster
Basic Info: Paul Foster, Labour MP for South Ribble
Property Analysis:
He!She has claimed £22,896 in accommodation expenses since the last election.
He!She has claimed for his!her utility bills to be paid by the taxpayer. Property Analysis: He!She has claimed £18,272 in accommodation expenses since the last election.

His!Her expense total comes from £18,272 in accommodation costs, £11,649 in office costs and £4,600 in staffing costs.

name: Jade Botterill
Basic Info: Jade Botterill, Labour MP for Ossett and Denby Dale

name: Janet Daby
Basic Info: Janet Daby, Labour MP for Lewisham East
Other Analysis:
Janet Daby has claimed a total of £18,952 in expenses since the last election.
His!Her expense total comes from £14,452 in office costs and £4,500 in staffing costs.
In 2024, he!she voted to abolish universal winter fuel payments for 10 million pensioners. 2.5 million of these pensioners had 'incomes below levels needed for a dignified life', according to the Centre for Ageing Better.
He!She voted in support of the UC and PIP bill, which will cut the universal credit allowance for many disabled people by £2,080 per year.
